column4: What's the best file system for sharing between Ubuntu and OS X?
what's your criteria for "best" ?
Besides FAT and its limited self.
and define "sharing" too
Well, something other than NTFS, but is still easily read able between the two, on an external HDD.
Unless NTFS is the only easy-to-set-up-and-read FS...
so, really you mean "What FS should I use for my external hard disk to allow my mac and my ubuntu box to read it" ?

it's cool, just making sure I captured your question correctly :) ... you might try the mac-native fs (HFS+ or whatever it's called?) I think the Linux kernel can read that

in that case, it's probably the mac-fuse thing you need to look at then, or a format both can read.
